name: Dawn from Montmartre
description: Fine Art Photographic Print Nothing compares to a sunrise over the city of love. With its soft winter hues, Dawn from Montmartre was photographed from the front of the Basilica of the Sacré Cœur on Montmartre Hill, Paris. Each piece is hand signed in archival ink. Our prints are sized to fit perfectly in Ikea's stylish range of RIBBA frames and mattes (sold separately). Click the link below to see what size print you need for your frame. (Pictured is No. 7. 500 x 500 mm (Square) in the White finish RIBBA) › Click here for our paper & print sizing chart We use Hahnemühle Rag Matte papers for all our fine art photographic prints. This German milled paper stock is made of 100% cotton. Its fine, textured surface allows for impressive photographic reproductions whilst maintaining a high pictorial depth (click here for detailed paper information). All of our fine art reproductions are lab printed using Epson’s Professional Ultrachrome K3 archival inks, guaranteeing your print a lightfastness of over 100 years.

name: Wave Linocut
description: This limited organic print was directly inspired from our love & respect of mother nature and the ocean. A two colour handmade linoleum print, Wave Linocut comes hand numbered and signed in a limited edition of only 20 pieces. Printed on 100% recycled & acid free, Fabriano 120gsm cold pressed artist paper.

name: The Pass Walk lrg
description: Finished size 600 x 600 x 18 mm Acrylic on solid Birch Plywood The Pass Walk reflects the nostalgia in surfing that still lives and breaths in many small surf side communities across the East Coast of Australia. The original photograph was taken & titled from one of our most treasured surf breaks in Byron Bay, Australia. This individual piece is hand prepared, painted & printed onto locally sourced solid Birch Plywood. The finished wooden panel is hand stamped with our seal of approval, then treated with a low sheen satin finish to protect and ensure your unique piece of art lasts a lifetime. Included also are suitable frame hangers if you'd prefer to hang your piece. All works are original designs & photographs of Chez Beauvardia.

name: Quiver {2}
description: Finished size 115 x 120 x 22 mm Acrylic on solid Australian Black Bean timber Quiver was inspired from our love of surfing and the art of beautifully shaped boards. From the dove tail fish to the mini Simmons, the Lopez gun to the classic noserider, Quiver brings together the history of surfing and the craft we ride. This individual piece is hand prepared, painted & printed onto locally sourced Australian hardwood offcuts. The finished wooden block is hand stamped with our seal of approval, then treated with a low sheen satin finish to protect and ensure your unique piece of art lasts a lifetime. As a bonus gift, this piece comes housed in a custom sized and handmade, cotton drawstring bag. Great for giving as a gift or to transport your trusty old notebook. Included also is a small triangle framing hook and screw if you'd prefer to hang your piece. All works are original designs & photographs of Chez Beauvardia.

name: Walden Cycle {2}
description: Finished size 158 x 180 x 18 mm Acrylic on solid Australian Brush Box timber The iconic Australian beach shack & rusty old bicycle. Time spent in thought, reflection & easy living. The original inspired photograph of this piece was taken on one of our many surfing adventures to the pristine island of North Stradbroke. Walden Cycle comes completed with an inspiring quote from Henry David Thoreau's novel Walden. This individual piece is hand prepared, painted & printed onto locally sourced Australian hardwood offcuts. The finished wooden block is hand stamped with our seal of approval, then treated with a low sheen satin finish to protect and ensure your unique piece of art lasts a lifetime. As a bonus gift, this piece comes housed in a custom sized and handmade, cotton drawstring bag. Great for giving as a gift or to transport your trusty old notebook. Included also is a small triangle framing hook and screw if you'd prefer to hang your piece. All works are original designs & photographs of Chez Beauvardia.

name: Barossa Treescape
description: Finished size 265 x 155 x 40 mm Acrylic on solid Osage Orange timber Created on an organic and unique slab of beautifully finished Osage Orange timber. Barossa Treescape captures in its entirety the rolling hills and magnificent landscape of the South Australian Barossa Valley. This individual piece is hand prepared, painted & printed onto locally sourced Australian hardwood offcuts. The finished wooden block is hand stamped with our seal of approval, then treated with a low sheen satin finish to protect and ensure your unique piece of art lasts a lifetime. As a bonus gift, this piece comes housed in a custom sized and handmade, cotton drawstring bag. Great for giving as a gift or to transport your trusty old notebook. Included also is a small triangle framing hook and screw if you'd prefer to hang your piece. All works are original designs & photographs of Chez Beauvardia.

name: Port Fairy Lighthouse
description: Finished size 145 x 150 x 38 mm Acrylic on solid Victorian Ash timber Located on Griffiths Island at the mouth of the Moyne River is this beautiful historic landmark. Built in 1859, this lighthouse has faithfully guided ships into the calmer waters and security of the quaint Victorian township of Port Fairy. This individual piece is hand prepared, painted & printed onto locally sourced Australian hardwood offcuts. The finished wooden block is hand stamped with our seal of approval, then treated with a low sheen satin finish to protect and ensure your unique piece of art lasts a lifetime. As a bonus gift, this piece comes housed in a custom sized and handmade, cotton drawstring bag. Great for giving as a gift or to transport your trusty old notebook. Included also is a small triangle framing hook and screw if you'd prefer to hang your piece. All works are original designs & photographs of Chez Beauvardia.

name: Beach Cabins
description: Finished size 155 x 80 x 20 mm Acrylic on solid Australian Black Bean timber These small wooden change rooms could be found across many of Australia's favourite beaches in the early 1900's. Beach Cabins was inspired from these past years and the coastal culture & lifestyle lived once by so many. This individual piece is hand prepared, painted & printed onto locally sourced Australian hardwood offcuts. The finished wooden block is hand stamped with our seal of approval, then treated with a low sheen satin finish to protect and ensure your unique piece of art lasts a lifetime. As a bonus gift, this piece comes housed in a custom sized and handmade, cotton drawstring bag. Great for giving as a gift or to transport your trusty old notebook. Included also is a small triangle framing hook and screw if you'd prefer to hang your piece. All works are original designs & photographs of Chez Beauvardia.

name: Alley Slide lrg
description: Finished size 600 x 400 x 18 mm Acrylic on solid Birch Plywood With a rich palette of colour & depth, matched with a strong & striking composition. Alley Slide encompasses the style, finesse and soul of surfing in its truest form. This individual piece is hand prepared, painted & printed onto locally sourced solid Birch Plywood. The finished wooden panel is hand stamped with our seal of approval, then treated with a low sheen satin finish to protect and ensure your unique piece of art lasts a lifetime. Included also are suitable frame hangers if you'd prefer to hang your piece. All works are original designs & photographs of Chez Beauvardia.

name: Solace
description: Fine Art Photographic Print Solace is a bold black & white photograph taken in the colder winter months of Vevey, Switzerland. It's strong contrast and centralised composition, allows Solace to bring comfort, calm and a soothing vibe to any space it's housed. Each piece is hand signed in archival ink. Our prints are sized to fit perfectly in Ikea's stylish range of RIBBA frames and mattes (sold separately). Click the link below to see what size print you need for your frame. name: General Store
description: Fine Art Photographic Print Far west of Brisbane just outside of Boonah, lies the small town of Mt Alford. Surrounded by the vast open scrub & farmlands, Mt Alford boasts a school, a pub & this retro out of service General Store. Each piece is hand signed in archival ink. Our prints are sized to fit perfectly in Ikea's stylish range of RIBBA frames and mattes (sold separately). Click the link below to see what size print you need for your frame. (Pictured is No. 4. 420 x 297 mm (A3) in the Birch finish RIBBA) › Click here for our paper & print sizing chart We use Hahnemühle Rag Matte papers for all our fine art photographic prints. name: Barossa Treescape Triptych
description: Finished size 200 x 200 x 40 mm approx per piece Acrylic on solid Red River Gum Created on three organic and unique slabs of beautifully finished Red River Gum. Barossa Treescape captures in its entirety the rolling hills and magnificent landscape of the South Australian Barossa Valley in this rustic Triptych. Each individual piece is hand prepared, painted & printed onto locally sourced Australian hardwood offcuts. The finished wooden block is hand stamped with our seal of approval, then treated with a low sheen satin finish to protect and ensure your unique piece of art lasts a lifetime. Included also are three small triangle framing hooks and screws if you'd prefer to hang your pieces. All works are original designs & photographs of Chez Beauvardia.

name: Fibro Livin'
description: Limited Edition Fine Art Print (297 x 420mm) An ode to Australia's humble fibro beach shack. Fibro Livin' draws real life inspiration from one of Moffat's Beaches (on Queensland's Sunshine Coast), rapidly diminishing modernist abodes. This print comes in 5 tasty retro filled flavours to satisfy the finest of tastebuds, but be quick as it is limited to only 100 prints (20 in each colourway!). Each piece comes stamped and hand numbered in its series collection. Printed on 100% recycled 300GSM Cyclus uncoated paper (click here for detailed paper information), using water-based inks in Brisbane, Australia.
